name: Leftover Turkey Sandwich with Red Pepper Jelly
description: We get it, having what seems to be never ending meals of leftover turkey after the holiday season just isn’t that exciting. But, make it into a sandwich that’s got a sweet & tangy jelly in it, and you’ll be happy to eat this for a few lunches in a row.
preparation:
1. Place chopped turkey in 4-Cup Prep Bowl. Stir in mayo and wing seasoning to evenly coat.  
  2. Using Y Peeler, peel carrot. Continue to use peeler to scrape carrot into long, thin ribbons.  
  3. Lay bread on countertop. Spread jelly evenly on all 8 slices (facing side only). Divide arugula, turkey, and carrot ribbons between 4 slices. Top with remaining 4 slices and cut sandwiches from corner to corner to serve.
